org._7hills.liueri19.game

Class Move

  • java.lang.Object
    • org._7hills.liueri19.game.Move
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Castling

    public class Move
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores information related to a single move.
    Move objects are immutable.
    Author:
    liueri19

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Move(Piece piece, int[] to)
      Constructs a new Move object with piece as the initiator, moving from the current location of piece to to.
      Move(Piece piece, int[] from, int[] to)
      Constructs a new Move object with piece as the initiator, moving from from to to.
      Move(Piece piece, Piece subject, int[] to)
      Constructs a new Move object with piece as the initiator, moving from the current location of piece to to.
      Move(Piece piece, Piece subject, int[] from, int[] to)
      Constructs a new Move object with piece as the initiator, moving from from to to.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Move

        public Move(Piece piece,
            Piece subject,
            int[] from,
            int[] to)
        Constructs a new Move object with piece as the initiator, moving from from to to.
        Parameters:
        piece - the initiator of the move
        subject - the piece taken by the initiator, maybe null if no piece is taken
        from - the origin of the move
        to - the destination of the move

      • Move

        public Move(Piece piece,
            Piece subject,
            int[] to)
        Constructs a new Move object with piece as the initiator, moving from the current location of piece to to.
        Parameters:
        piece - the initiator of the move
        subject - the piece taken by the initiator, maybe null if no piece is taken
        to - the destination of the move

      • Move

        public Move(Piece piece,
            int[] from,
            int[] to)
        Constructs a new Move object with piece as the initiator, moving from from to to. Note that this constructor assumes no piece is taken.
        Parameters:
        piece - the initiator of the move
        from - the origin of the move
        to - the destination of the move

      • Move

        public Move(Piece piece,
            int[] to)
        Constructs a new Move object with piece as the initiator, moving from the current location of piece to to. Note that this constructor assumes no piece is taken.
        Parameters:
        piece - the initiator of the move
        to - the destination of the move

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of this Move object.

        A move will be formated as:
        [initiating_piece][origin_file][origin_rank][destination_file][destination_rank]
        A white Pawn move from E2 to E4 would be represented as:
        WPe2e4

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object move)
        Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this Move.

        Returns true if and only if:
        the specified object is an instance of Move, and
        this Move has the same origin as the specified Move, and
        this Move has the same destination as the specified Move, and
        this Move has the same initiating Piece as the specified Move.

        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        move - the Object to be compared with

      • copy

        public Move copy()
        Returns a deep copy of this Move object. This method is effectively the same as calling Move(Piece piece, Piece subject, int[] from, int[] to) with the same values from this object.
        Returns:
        a deep copy of this Move object
